intro: Pelecynthis racemosa, commonly known as the clustered pelecynthis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in racemes, giving it its scientific name. Pelecynthis racemosa is often used in traditional medicine and has a distinctive, spicy scent.
